"comprised of"
re-adding source. "country" used as "region" (like "wine country" - not an actual country); removed "informally"
Biger calls it a country, did not use the term "informal", and says it was a political, rather than a geographical, area
/* 20th century */ they're referring to the other Biger source, listed in the bibliography. "informally" because it was lots of varying definitions and concepts, based on various opinions
Biger does not say anything about informal European usage in pages 13-15, The delimitation of the country at the end of the Ottoman period
rv - source is Biger, as cited below. It was part of the Ottoman empire at that time.

/* Boundaries */ Transjordan was not disattached. It was added to the mandate after San Remo and was administered separately under the terms of the mandate

rv fringe claims - it was a mandate, not a state.
